text: The MacKinnon Apartments are a historic apartment building at 236 Third Street in Juneau, Alaska. It is a three-story wood frame structure, finished in stucco, with corner quoining and a dentillated cornice. When originally built in 1925, it was long and housed six single-bedroom and 12 studio apartments. In 1959 another were added, housing another five studio units. The building is a representative of Juneau's boom years in the 1920s, when the local gold rush peaked. The building was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2000. ==See also== *National Register of Historic Places listings in Juneau, Alaska ==References== Category:Residential buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Alaska Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1925 Category:Buildings and structures in Juneau, Alaska Category:Buildings and structures on the National Register of Historic Places in Juneau, Alaska Category:Apartment buildings in Alaska
title: MacKinnon Apartments
